instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.TPS51125: What is TPS51125? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1278 model Macbooks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on when LVDS cable plugged in
threads.message:
Hi,

I bought this shit from craigslist.
The lady said she spilled some water on the macbook.
She heard some [COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]sizzling and she couldn't turn it back on anymore.

The macbook is in a pristine condition.
I took it apart and I couldn't find where the water was spilled.
No corrosion on the board. Maybe a little corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C3897</CAPACITOR>,

I cleaned the whole board. After I dried it I attached the power cable and it turned on.
I attached the speaker and I heard the dong sound. I put it back to the macbook and it didn't turn on.
I disconnected all the cable except the LVDS cable. It still didn't power on. After I removed the LVDS cable it turned on.
I tried with a different LCD same thing. I replaced the LVDS connector. Still nothing. It won't even try to turn on.
It doesn't do anything. Fan is not spinning. Nothing at all.

I pulled the backlight fuse. I thought maybe something with the backlight circuit. No luck.
I pulled [/FONT][/COLOR]L9004 and it turns on. Has backlight, but of course no picture. I checked everything for short or low resistance.
I replaced L9004 and <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>. These didn't solve anything.
[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]I pulled <CAPACITOR>C9011</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9012</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR>. Same shit.
I pulled <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> again and solder a wire from Pin 2,3 to Pin 4,5. The 3.3V rail is jumping up and down and it does not turn on.
I know my test LCD is good. I just used it yesterday. Anyway I would believe something is wrong with the LCD.

Any thoughts? [/FONT][/COLOR]

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on when LVDS cable plugged in
threads.message: Did you check L9004 for shorts with the LCD plugged in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on when LVDS cable plugged in
threads.message:
Yes, I did. That was the first thing I did. No short on L9004.
5K range when LCD plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on when LVDS cable plugged in
threads.message:
I removed L9004 and attached my bench PSU on pin2.

It draws 0.21xxA when the macbook is turned off.
When it turns on it draws 0.23xxA and have picture.
WTF should I do with this macbook?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on when LVDS cable plugged in
threads.message: So if the LCD is plugged in it will not even spin the fan, totally dead? This makes no sense because nothing should happen on L9004 until <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is switched on, this will only happen after the dong and the LCD is recognized. Is there 3V on L9004 immediately after you apply power?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on when LVDS cable plugged in
threads.message:
No, the fan won't even spin if the LCD connected. Totally dead. Nothing on L9004 when I apply power.
Looks like it has a problem with the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> rail. When I try to turn it on when LCD connected the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> collapse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on when LVDS cable plugged in
threads.message: I changed the <CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP> and now everything is working fine. Problem solved. Thanks for your help!
